column2: August 25]], [[1957]]) is a professional writer and photographer, who travels around the world to capture iconic landscapes from movies on camera. One of his most successful works is ''[[The Lord of the Rings Location Guidebook]]'', which sold a record 320,000 copies in his native New Zealand alone. A revised edition and an extended, coffeetable edition were also published. Brodie also did research for the New Zealand documentary ''[[DNZ: The Real Middle Earth]]''.

column1: Brodie was awarded ''Membership of the New Zealand Order of Merit'' for services to the [[New Zealand]] tourism industry, which blossomed thanks to his book.
He also cameoed as a Gondorian breadseller in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]''.
